abstract: As Bank of America begins to restart foreclosure proceedings, the bank said that it had discovered errors, including incorrect data and misspelled names, in the paperwork it had reviewed.
snippet: As Bank of America begins to restart foreclosure proceedings, the bank said that it had discovered errors, including incorrect data and misspelled names, in the paperwork it had reviewed.
lead_paragraph: Even as Bank of America begins to restart foreclosure proceedings in 23 states on Monday, the bank confirmed that it had discovered errors, including incorrect data and misspelled names, in the paperwork it had reviewed, Nelson D. Schwartz reports in The New York Times.

headline.main: Foreclosures Had Errors, Bank of America Finds

abstract: A marketing experiment where transit riders can access e-books and more by using a smartphone to scan a poster on the wall.
snippet: A marketing experiment where transit riders can access e-books and more by using a smartphone to scan a poster on the wall.
lead_paragraph: SHARON BOLTON spotted “those funky tags” — known formally as two-dimensional bar codes — when she took her college-age daughter to catch a train at the Rensselaer rail station near Albany last week.

headline.main: Testing a Bar Code Technology for Smartphones
headline.print_headline: Testing a Bar Code Technology for 2-D Smartphones

abstract: Samuel D. Waksal’s new company, Kadmon Pharmaceuticals, said that it had acquired Three Rivers Pharmaceuticals, which mainly sells drugs to treat hepatitis C.
snippet: Samuel D. Waksal’s new company, Kadmon Pharmaceuticals, said that it had acquired Three Rivers Pharmaceuticals, which mainly sells drugs to treat hepatitis C.
lead_paragraph: Samuel D. Waksal, the biotechnology executive whose insider trading landed him and his friend Martha Stewart in prison, is trying to make a comeback.

headline.main: Former ImClone Chief Acquires Drug Company
headline.print_headline: Former ImClone Chief Acquires Drug Company
